Jefferson County Commission

RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.0	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility is committed to the safety of our workers, the public, and the environment. The resources invested in the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances demonstrate this commitment. The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility implements reasonable controls, such as training of personnel and the safe design, installation, operation and maintenance of our processes. Our policy is to make every effort to prevent the release of hazardous substances but in the event of a release, our trained personnel and local emergency response agencies will respond to control and contain the release in a manner that will be safe for workers and will help prevent injuries to the public or the environment.

2.0 Description of The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility and Regulated Substances

The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility handles two substances regulated by the Risk Management Plan Rule (RMP Rule) in quantities above the Threshold Quantity. These substances are:

* Chlorine - stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for disinfection of the water.
* Sulfur dioxide- stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for dechlorination of water.

3.0 Hazard Assessment

The RMP Rule requires The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility to perform a Hazard Assessment of the regulated substances stored and used in the covered processes at the facility. This Hazard Assessment includes an offsite consequence analysis for the following scenarios:

* One worst-case and one alternative release scenario for each of the toxic substances sulfur dioxide and chlorine used in the disinfection and dechlorination of effluent at the facilit

f the incident. The results of the investigation are documented, recommendations are resolved, and appropriate process enhancements are implemented.

4.8 Chemical-specific Prevention Steps - Process chemicals

Industry standards are followed at The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility to help ensure safe handling of process chemicals. The vendor supplies chlorine and sulfur dioxide via a Department of Transportation (DOT) approved truck and in DOT approved 1 ton cylinders. The process equipment is designed and constructed with state-of-the-art materials and technology utilizing the standards and guidelines of the Chlorine Institute, American Water Works Association, ASME, ANSI, and other applicable codes. Workers who perform operations involving chlorine and sulfur dioxide receive training emphasizing safe handling procedures according to the guidelines required by The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility.

5.0 Five Year Accident History

There has been no accidents or incidents that resulted in injuries to employee, the public, or the environment The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility in the past five years.

6.0 Emergency Response Programs

The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility has prepared a written emergency action plan that complies with the RMP Rule, other federal standards and industry guidelines. This plan has been communicated to the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and local fire department. 

7.0 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility continuously attempts to improve the safety of our processes to protect our employees, the public and the environment. Water Reclamation Facility develops and maintains operating procedures to define how tasks related to process operations should be performed. The operating procedures are used to:

1. train employees and contractors, and
2. serve as reference guides for appropriate actions to take during both normal and abnormal process conditions.

4.4 Training

The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility trains personnel in the operating procedures to help ensure safe and effective performance of their assigned tasks. A record of all training is maintained to help ensure new and refresher training is provided on a timely basis.

4.5 Maintenance 

The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility properly maintains the equipment in our processes. The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility maintenance program includes:

1. procedures to safely guide workers in their maintenance tasks,
2. worker training in the maintenance procedures, and
3. inspection and testing program to help identify equipment deterioration and damage before equipment fails.

4.6 Compliance Audits

The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility performs periodic (at least every three years) audits of covered processes to verify the processes are operating in compliance with the requirements of the RMP Rule. A compliance audit report is prepared after each audit, and any deficiencies noted by the audit are corrected in a timely manner.

4.7 Incident Investigations

The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility investigates all incidents that could reasonably have resulted in a serious injury to personnel, the public, or the environment. The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility trains employees to identify and report any and all incidents requiring investigation. 4.0 Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

The RMP Rule requires that a prevention program be established for The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility disinfection process. The following details the prevention program elements at The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility that apply to these processes.

4.1 Safety Information

The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility maintains a variety of technical documents that are used to help ensure safe operation of The Jefferson County Commission  Water Treatment Plant processes. Material safety data sheets (MSDSs) document the physical and chemical properties of hazardous substances handled at The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility, including chlorine and sulfur dioxide used in the covered process. The engineering design documents include the operating parameters, the design basis and configuration of the equipment in each covered process, and references to applicable codes and standards. 
	
4.2 Hazard Review

The Jefferson County Commission Village Creek Water Reclamation Facility performs and periodically updates hazard reviews of the covered processes to help identify and control process hazards. Checklists are used to guide the hazard review. These checklists include items to help ensure The Jefferson County Commission  Wastewater Treatment Plant operates and maintains the equipment in a manner consistent with the applicable design specifications, codes, standards, and regulations.
